definition: to arrange in order/to compile/to prepare (a budget, project etc)
to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate
to arrange/to line up/file/series/(in data tables) column/(Tw) row

sentences.english: This list looks at 10 modern examples of hostage taking.
sentences.chinese: 这份目录选出10大现代人质挟持编列成表。

sentences.english: The list is compiled by a panel of international experts.
sentences.chinese: 该名单由一个国际专家小组编列。

sentences.english: Accountability and budgeting are key elements to drive down the deficit.
sentences.chinese: 会计责任和预算编列压低赤字的两大主要元素。

sentences.english: The list was compiled by a panel of international experts.
sentences.chinese: 该名单由一个国际专家小组编列。

definition: to set/to designate/to stipulate/to provide/to draw up/to formulate (rules etc)/stipulation
financial year/fiscal year (e.g. from April to March, for tax purposes)
labor committee/abbr. for 勞動委員會|劳动委员会
to lay down (a rule, a plan of action)/to draw up/booked out (i.e. already fully booked)
Executive Yuan, the executive branch of government under the constitution of Republic of China, then of Taiwan
to stipulate/to state expressly/to explicitly provide for
